definition: to wait upon/to serve/to attend to sb's needs
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)

sentences.english: You can- not serve two masters; you must serve one or the other.
sentences.chinese: 你不能侍奉兩個主人，你必須擇一而從。

sentences.english: I usually work longer hours during writing leave than during regular ministry seasons.
sentences.chinese: 通常在此期間我比平常侍奉時工作時間更長。

sentences.english: Is not remorse the justice which is administered by that very law which you would fain serve?
sentences.chinese: 難道悔恨不正是你們所侍奉的法律實施的公正？

sentences.english: The king's defilers are feared and powerful wizards traditionally in the service of the sorcerermonarchs.
sentences.chinese: 王室褻瀆者是世襲侍奉巫王的恐怖而強大的法師。

sentences.english: A dainty dish to set before the King.
sentences.chinese: 一道精緻的大菜向君王侍奉。

sentences.english: I have served you for many years , but you are never willing to comfort me even once .
sentences.chinese: 多年來我辛苦侍奉你，你卻一點也不慰勞我。

sentences.english: Repeatedly, the Bible says to "serve the Lord with all your heart.
sentences.chinese: 聖經上接二連三的要我們“盡心盡意的侍奉主”。

sentences.english: You cannot serve both God and Money.
sentences.chinese: 你們不能又侍奉神，又侍奉瑪門。

sentences.english: You cannot serve both God and Money.
sentences.chinese: 你們不能又侍奉神，又侍奉瑪門。

sentences.english: To wayt on Love amongst his lovely crew;
sentences.chinese: 侍奉愛神去充當可愛的僕人。

sentences.english: The lotus offers its beauty to the heaven, the grass its service to the earth.
sentences.chinese: 菡萏向長天誇口它的嬌美，小草則緘默地侍奉土地。

sentences.english: He had served so many high-class citizens, the rich, the governors, and the new-rich wannabes.
sentences.chinese: 他侍奉了很多上層人物，富翁，政客，和新貴們。

sentences.english: We serve the Dark Lord every day.
sentences.chinese: 我們每天都侍奉黑魔王。

sentences.english: Those who set out to serve God and Mammon soon discover that there is no God.
sentences.chinese: 同時侍奉上帝和財神的，很快就會發現上帝沒了。

sentences.english: Serve(55)your departed(56)parents as if they were still alive.
sentences.chinese: 侍奉你過世的父母親要如同他們在世的時候一樣。

sentences.english: He smites his fellow servants, accusing and condemning those who are faithful to their Master.
sentences.chinese: 他打他的同伴，控告並譴責忠心侍奉主的人。

definition: to attend to/to care for (patients etc)/to look after/to wait upon/to serve/also written 伏侍, see also 服事[fu2 shi4]
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
special favor from a ruler/Emperor's generosity towards a favorite
to vow loyalty and devotion to
